node.title: Two Australian veterans receive prestigious US Silver Star award 50 years after being nominated
node.alt: Two men in suits compare military awards.
node.description: Two Australian veterans are awarded the third-highest military combat decoration from the United States for their service to the US duringÂ the Vietnam War.
node.content:
["Two Australian\u00a0veterans have been awarded the third-highest military combat decoration from the United States, one posthumously, for their service to the US in the Vietnam War.", "Late Warrant Officer\u00a0Kevin Wheatley and retired Group Captain Macaulay\u00a0Cottrell were each awarded a Silver Star for\u00a0valour in combat while serving with US\u00a0military units in the 1960s.", "Group Captain\u00a0Cottrell was awarded the honour for his service as a Flying Officer in 1968, directing an aircraft in dangerous weather and under fire to identify areas in need of combat support missions.\u00a0", "Warrant Officer Wheatley received his Silver Star for his leadership in the charge against a Viet Cong village in 1965.", "Mr Wheatley was also awarded a Victoria Cross posthumously in 1967 for his service in the Vietnam War for a separate act that cost his life. His son, George\u00a0Wheatley, has now accepted both awards on his father's behalf.", "US Embassy Charg\u00e9 d'Affaires Michael Goldman\u00a0presented the medals to Group Captain\u00a0Cottrell and Warrant Officer\u00a0Wheatley's son,\u00a0emphasising that\u00a0the award honoured the\u00a0\"remarkable acts of service\" of the two men.", "\"Group Captain Cottrell and Warrant Officer Wheatley are being recognised for their actions during the Vietnam conflict while serving with US\u00a0military units. Both officers illustrated remarkable bravery and sacrifice,\" he said.", "Group Captain Cottrell said receiving a Silver Star brought back memories of those he served alongside.", "\"It is a great honour to accept this award from the US government,\" he said.", "\"I'm just thankful that I'm still here. Some people weren't so lucky.", "
Recognition more than 50 years on
", "", "
George Wheatley, son of the late Kevin Wheatley, accepted a Victoria Cross on his father's behalf in 1967.(Supplied: Australian War Memorial)
", "George\u00a0Wheatley said\u00a0his father should have been given his Silver Star sooner, but defence policy meant he remained a nominee, not a recipient, until now.", "US\u00a0officers recommended Warrant Officer Wheatley for the Silver Star 56 years ago, but because of a longstanding ban on Australians receiving foreign medals, it took until now for him to be officially recognised.", "\"It's wonderful for Mum because it's\u00a0not an end to Dad's story, but it's an end to one chapter in Dad's\u00a0life.\"", "", "
Kevin Arthur Wheatley served and died in the Vietnam War, and has now been posthumously awarded the Silver Star.(Supplied: Australian War Memorial)
", "Group Captain Cottrell also had to wait more than 50 years to officially get his Silver Star, but said finally receiving it was a privilege.", "\"After 53 years, it's a great honour,\" he said.", "\"We weren't able to accept it back in the 60s when we came home from Vietnam, but it's a really great privilege.\"", "Mr Wheatley said the Silver Star award ceremony was a much happier celebration of his father's life than when he accepted the Victoria Cross on his behalf.", "\"When I received that Victoria Cross I was 13, it was a sombre occasion then.\u00a0I was proud of it, but it was sombre,\" he said.", "\"I think the best thing about today is Dad's great-grandchildren are here. They go to the marches [and] they hear about their grandfather.", "
US Embassy celebrates Aussie mateship
", "", "
George Wheatley accepted\u00a0a Silver Star from US Embassy\u00a0Charg\u00e9 d'Affaires Michael Goldman,\u00a0on behalf of George's late\u00a0father Kevin Wheatley.(Supplied: US\u00a0Embassy)
", "Mr Goldman said the mateship offered by Australians to the American armed forces was remembered and valued highly by the United States.", "\"The US-Australia Alliance,\u00a0and the strong democratic values at its core,\u00a0is an anchor for peace and stability in the region.\"", "Mr Goldman said these qualities were evident in both Group Captain\u00a0Cottrell\u00a0and\u00a0Warrant Officer Wheatley.", "\"[The Alliance]\u00a0will continue to deliver for Australians, Americans, and our friends and partners throughout the world,\" he said."]
